page.title: 03Communications in Caerhun
page.content: There is a telephone in nearly every home and a public telephone at the centre of Rowen village. Every house owns a radio and television set. Welsh and English magazines and daily newspapers may be purchased at the local shop. There is a sub-Post Office in the middle of Rowen village which is also a general store that provides a vital link for this scattered community. The Royal Mail delivers every morning from Conwy and collects at about 4.00 pm daily. There is a strong feeling of mutual caring within the community.
